alert.note: Alert for Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mingo County through 600 PM EDT... At 529 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chattaroy, or 7 miles north of Williamson, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Delbarton, Chattaroy, Dingess, Myrtle and Lenore. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 1 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
